articles.author: Jarrett Renshaw
articles.description: One of the largest U.S. privately owned auto transport companies is quietly mounting a long-shot bid - with increasing interest from the Biden administration - to rescue trucking giant Yellow Corp (YELLQ.PK) from bankruptcy liquidation and bring back some 30,000 union jobs, according to multiple sources familiar with the discussions.
articles.title: Exclusive: Trucking firm prepares long-shot bid for Yellow, seeks US Treasury support

articles.author: Ron Bousso, David French
articles.description: BP (BP.L) is seeking to form joint ventures around its U.S. onshore natural gas fields to expand production and cut costs as rival energy giants rush to scale up shale businesses, three sources with direct knowledge of the talks told Reuters.
articles.title: Exclusive: BP explores forming joint ventures to boost US shale -sources

articles.author: Leroy Leo
articles.description: Thousands of employees at CVS Health Corp (CVS.N) and Walgreens Boots Alliance's (WBA.O) U.S. pharmacies are planning a three-day walkout starting Monday, in an attempt to get the companies to improve working conditions and recruit more people, among other issues.
articles.title: Pharmacy staff from CVS, Walgreens stores in US plan 3-day walkout

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Sundar Pichai, CEO of Google, criticized Microsoft's browser Monday in a once-in-a generation antitrust fight with the U.S. government while arguing his company's browser and internet search were easy to use and secure.
articles.title: Google CEO lashes out at Microsoft in defense of search practices at US trial

articles.author: Ananya Mariam Rajesh, Aishwarya Venugopal
articles.description: In a strong quarter for earnings, the big consumer stocks have shone even brighter, thanks to results from McDonald's (MCD.N), Chipotle Mexican Grill (CMG.N) and others that rank among the biggest surprises of the reporting cycle so far.
articles.title: From Amazon to McDonald's, strong earnings show U.S. consumer resilience

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Shares of Tesla (TSLA.O) fell about 5% on Monday after key supplier Panasonic Holdings (6752.T) said it cut automotive battery production in the September quarter, cementing concerns of a global slowdown in electric-vehicle (EV) sales.
articles.title: Tesla falls as production cut by battery supplier Panasonic fans EV demand fears

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The FedEx Master Executive Council, the governing body of the delivery firm's unit in the Air Line Pilots Association (ALPA), said on Monday it had elected a new interim chair after union members rejected a tentative contract with the company in July.
articles.title: FedEx pilots union picks interim leader after rejecting tentative deal

articles.author: Laila Bassam, Tom Perry
articles.description: With dozens of Hezbollah fighters killed in three weeks of border clashes with Israel, the Lebanese group is working to stem its losses as it prepares for the possibility of a drawn-out conflict, three sources familiar with its thinking said.
articles.title: Exclusive: Lebanon's Hezbollah works to curb hefty losses in Israel clashes, sources say

articles.author: Raphael Satter, Katie Paul, Sheila Dang
articles.description: Maria Julia Cassis was sitting down to a meal in her terraced home in north London when her 6-year-old son ran into the dining room, his face pale.
articles.title: Graphic pro-Israel ads make their way into children’s video games

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Russia has significantly bulked up its forces around the devastated city of Bakhmut in the east and has switched its troops from a defensive posture to taking "active actions", a Ukrainian military commander said on Monday.
articles.title: Russia beefs up forces near Bakhmut, switches from defensive posture - Ukraine commander
